result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan S Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent. 
Within 10 days, Defendant to provide a written apology to Farm & Fleet and provide a copy to the Court.

If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
CORRECTED 3/27/14 TO INCLUDE THE MANADATORY DNA SURCHARGE.

timeConds.notes: 40 hours to be completed in Barron County. The remaining 40 hours can be completed in Chippewa County or where ever the Defendant resides.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jonathan S Johnson in court with attorney John G. Hinde.  Angela L. Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 2. DRI - Count 1.  The Court finds Defendant's plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the Defendant guilty to Count 2. State relates. Defense relates. Defendant makes statement. 

Court orders:
SW
1 year Probation - concurrent with Probation in 13CF254.
$100 fine plus court costs
80 hours of Community Service  - 40 hours to be completed in Barron County, the remaining 40 hours can be completed in Chippewa County or wherever Defendant resides.
Expunction will be granted by the court if all court obligations, supervision fees and restitution are paid in full and upon defendant's successful completion of probation or sentence.  
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Within 10 days, Defendant to provide a written apology to Farm & Fleet and provide a copy to the Court.

Defendant Jonathan S Johnson in court with attorney Gary E Smith.  Defendant Jonathan S Johnson in Custody.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives preliminary hearing.  
Court accepts waiver of preliminary hearing, finds probable cause and binds defendant over.
Information filed.
Defendant pleads Not Guilty on both counts.
Bond Continues in present form.

  Plea hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 6, 2014 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Jonathan S Johnson in court with attorney Gary E Smith.  Defendant Jonathan S Johnson in custody.  Angela L Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Will track with Case 13CF254 - Judge Bitney.  State requests bond revoked.  Argument by Attorney Smith.  Court revokes bond 13CF254.
Preliminary Hearing will set with Judge Bitney.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-537-1191.  
Must have no contact with Farm & Fleet of Rice Lake.
